techmeme.title: Texas sues Allstate and its subsidiary Arity, accusing the insurer of illegally collecting and selling data about people's driving behavior through mobile apps (Kashmir Hill/New York Times)
Microsoft is creating a new "CoreAI - Platform and Tools" unit led by Jay Parikh, the ex-Lacework CEO and Meta engineering executive who joined in October 2024 (Todd Bishop/GeekWire)
IAC board approves the spinoff of home improvement marketplace Angi; IAC has previously spun off companies like Expedia, Ticketmaster, and LendingTree (Salvador Rodriguez/CNBC)
The SEC says that two Robinhood broker-dealers agreed to pay $45M in combined penalties to settle charges that they violated over 10 securities law provisions (Dan Mangan/CNBC)
A US court rules the SEC must "explain itself" on why, when pressed by Coinbase, it failed to clarify its rules or offer clear new rules for crypto securities (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)
